meanings.sent1: The teacher will promulgate the test results to the students tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to promulgate their new product through a press release.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel promulgated its discovery of a hidden acorn to the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun promulgated its warmth across the sleepy town.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker promulgated the emergency alert throughout the building.

meanings.sent1: The mayor will promulgate the new city ordinance at the town hall meeting.
meanings.sent2: The president promulgated the new law during his speech to the nation.
meanings.sent3: The cat promulgated its ownership of the house by leaving its fur on every piece of furniture.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm promulgated its power with booming thunder and bright lightning.
meanings.sent5: The chef promulgated the daily specials with a colorful chalkboard display.
